main event: A civilian observed one round object, the size of a golf ball, visually for 25 minutes in Canton, Ohio, on August 24, 1956.
interesting points: The object was stationary and emitted no sound., The observation lasted for a total of three hours and 30 minutes., The observer noted the position of Venus during the sighting., The object was described as having a silver color., The document concluded the object was possibly astronomical.
sighted object: a round object, size of a golf ball
witness description: Dave, 32 years old, from Painsville, Ohio, T/Sgt, 3rd Detachment
